001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.Array;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.JavaNumberTypeSupport;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
006
007/**
008 * A simple linear scalar model of the form:
009 * <pre>
010 *   f(x) = bias + Σ w_i * x_i
011 * </pre>
012 * where the bias and weights are trainable parameters.
013 * <p>
014 * This class supports forward estimation of the scalar output as well as
015 * calculation of parameter parameterGradients required for gradient-based training.
016 */
017@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
018public class AffineTransformation<N extends Number> extends LinearCombination<N> {
019
020    private final JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport;
021    private Array<N> parameters;
022
023    /**
024     * Creates a new {@code AffineTransformation} with the specified number of input dimensions.
025     * <p>
026     * The underlying parameter vector will have length {@code dimensions + 1},
027     * with the first element reserved for the bias and the rest for the weights.
028     *
029     * @param dimensions number of input features
030     * @return a new {@code AffineTransformation} instance with zero-initialized parameters
031     */
032    public static <N extends Number> AffineTransformation<N> create(int dimensions, JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport) {
033        return new AffineTransformation<>(typeSupport.createArray(dimensions + 1), typeSupport);
034    }
035
036
037    /**
038     * Constructs a {@code AffineTransformation} with the given parameter vector.
039     * <p>
040     * The first element of the array is treated as the bias, while the subsequent
041     * elements are the weights.
042     *
043     * @param parameters the parameters
044     */
045    public AffineTransformation(Array<N> parameters, JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport) {
046        super(parameters.slice(1), typeSupport);
047        this.typeSupport = typeSupport;
048        this.parameters = parameters;
049    }
050
051    /**
052     * Estimates the scalar output of this affine transformation for the given input vector.
053     * <p>
054     * The computation is:
055     * <pre>
056     *   output = bias + Σ (inputs[i] * weights[i])
057     * </pre>
058     *
059     * @param inputs the input feature vector
060     * @return the scalar output value
061     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code inputs.length != arity()}
062     */
063    @Override
064    public N estimateScalar(Array<N> inputs) {
065        return typeSupport.add(getBias(), super.estimateScalar(inputs));
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * Calculates the parameterGradients of the output with respect to all parameters (bias and weights)
070     * for the given input vector.
071     * <p>
072     * The gradient vector has length {@code 1 + arity()}, where:
073     * <ul>
074     *   <li>Index 0 corresponds to the derivative w.r.t. the bias (always {@code 1}).</li>
075     *   <li>Indices 1..arity correspond to the input values, i.e. ∂f/∂w_i = input[i-1].</li>
076     * </ul>
077     *
078     * @param inputs the input feature vector
079     * @return the gradient vector (bias gradient followed by weight parameterGradients)
080     */
081    @Override
082    public Array<N> calculateParameterGradients(Array<N> inputs) {
083        Array<N> gradients = typeSupport.createArray(1 + arity());
084        gradients.set(0, typeSupport.one());
085        if (arity() > 0) {
086            gradients.set(super.calculateParameterGradients(inputs), 1);
087        }
088        return gradients;
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * {@inheritDoc}
093     */
094    @Override
095    public int getParameterCount() {
096        return super.getParameterCount() + 1;
097    }
098
099    /**
100     * Returns the full parameter vector of this model.
101     * The first element is the bias, the rest are the weights.
102     *
103     * @return the parameter array
104     */
105    @Override
106    public Array<N> getParameters() {
107        return parameters;
108    }
109
110    /**
111     * {@inheritDoc}
112     */
113    @Override
114    public N getParameter(int p) {
115        return parameters.get(p);
116    }
117
118    /**
119     * {@inheritDoc}
120     */
121    @Override
122    public void setParameters(Array<N> values) {
123        parameters = values;
124        super.setParameters(values.slice(1));
125    }
126
127    /**
128     * {@inheritDoc}
129     */
130    @Override
131    public void setParameter(int p, N value) {
132        parameters.set(p, value);
133    }
134
135    /**
136     * {@inheritDoc}
137     */
138    @Override
139    public void adjustParameters(Array<N> deltas) {
140        for (int p = 0; p < parameters.length(); p++) {
141            adjustParameter(p, deltas.get(p));
142        }
143    }
144
145    /**
146     * {@inheritDoc}
147     */
148    @Override
149    public void adjustParameter(int p, N delta) {
150        parameters.set(p, typeSupport.add(parameters.get(p), delta));
151    }
152
153    /**
154     * Returns the bias parameter.
155     *
156     * @return the bias value (0.0f if there are no parameters)
157     */
158    public N getBias() {
159        return parameters.get(0);
160    }
161
162    /**
163     * Sets the bias parameter.
164     *
165     * @param bias the new bias value
166     */
167    public void setBias(N bias) {
168        parameters.set(0, bias);
169    }
170
171    /**
172     * Adjusts the bias parameter by adding {@code delta}.
173     *
174     * @param delta the adjustment value
175     */
176    public void adjustBias(N delta) {
177        adjustParameter(0, delta);
178    }
179
180}
